headline.print_headline: In Naples, Gift of Coffee to Strangers Never Seen
headline.main: In Naples, Gift of Coffee to Strangers Never Seen

lead_paragraph: The Neapolitan tradition of “suspended coffee” — paying for two, drinking one and leaving the receipt for the other for a stranger — has spread around the world.
abstract: Neapolitan tradition known as 'suspended coffee,' in which customers pay for two coffees at cafes and leave receipt behind so that a stranger may receive free cup, is being revived both in Naples and around the world; simple act of generosity, which boomed during World War II, seeks to help those stricken by today's hard economic times.
